The first Bohemian monarch to sit on the imperial throne was Charles IV.</paragraph><paragraph>神圣罗马帝国不仅是罗马灭亡后追随其辉煌的一个国家地理区域，也是一个具有重要象征意义的社会政治权力机构。它并不是一个统一的国家，而是由许多不同国家组成的松散联盟。从官方记载来看，神圣罗马帝国的历史从962年持续到1806年，其领土面积和成员国经常发生变化。在15世纪之前，神圣罗马帝国的皇帝是由所谓的“选帝侯”选举产生的，后来哈布斯堡王朝开始世袭王位。每位皇帝的加冕都伴随着许多政治斗争，尤其是来自教会的争端，教会力争掌握所谓的授职权，并希望在加冕活动中发挥不可或缺的作用。因此，每位皇帝都必须接受教皇亲自授予的称号。</paragraph><paragraph>波希米亚公国在11世纪初成为了神圣罗马帝国的一部分，但得益于普热米斯尔·奥托卡一世（Premysl Otakar I）的努力，波希米亚在帝国内部享有特殊地位：波希米亚君主无需向神圣罗马帝国履行任何义务，除了参加议会。而首位登上神圣罗马帝国皇位的波希米亚君主则是查理四世。</paragraph>
ui_codex_cont_svatovaclavska<paragraph>For the coronation of Charles IV as King of Bohemia, a new unique crown was made - the St Wenceslas Crown. It was made from the old Přemyslid Crown and the monarch himself dedicated it to St Wenceslas. No Czech king was allowed to wear it, he could only borrow it for a fee on the occasion of his coronation. The crown is made of pure gold adorned with gemstones and pearls, and is kept in a chamber with seven locks above the St Wenceslas chapel in Prague Cathedral. The keys are held by the leaders of the Czech State: the President, the Prime Minister, the Archbishop of Prague etc. There is a legend that if the Crown is worn on the head of anyone other than the rightful Czech King, the wearer will soon die. It is reported that during WWII, the Nazi Reichsprotector for Bohemia and Moravia, Reinhard Heidrich, put it on – and died shortly afterwards at the hands of assassins. The story is probably apocryphal, but certainly interesting.</paragraph><paragraph>查理四世加冕为波西米亚国王之后，定制了一顶独特的崭新王冠——圣瓦茨拉夫王冠。它由旧的普热米斯尔王冠改造而成，并由查理四世亲自奉献给圣瓦茨拉夫。捷克国王不被允许佩戴这顶王冠，只能在加冕仪式上付费借用。王冠由纯金制成，镶嵌着宝石和珍珠，现保存在布拉格大教堂圣瓦茨拉夫小礼拜堂上层的一间七锁室内。钥匙由捷克国家的领导人持有：总统、总理、布拉格大主教等。传说，如果并非合法捷克国王之人妄图染指王冠，他将因报应而死去。而据说在二战期间，波希米亚和摩拉维亚纳粹行政长官莱因哈特·海德里希曾戴上这顶皇冠，不久便死于刺客之手。这个故事虽然很可能是杜撰的，但着实为这顶王冠增添了传奇色彩。</paragraph>
ui_codex_cont_taboreni<paragraph>In the Middle Ages, various groups of soldiers, bandits, guards, or lone warriors roamed the lands, often changing their place of residence. They lived in makeshift buildings, shelters, or tents erected around a central fire. Sometimes they stayed in one camp for several days, sometimes only for one night before moving again.</paragraph><paragraph>Key factors for choosing a <accent>suitable campsite</accent> included access to water, food, fodder, and wood. Camps were rarely set up in villages or near castles. Only the retinues of lords and nobility stayed there. During wars or while fleeing, they camped under the open sky, as there was no time to build or dismantle a camp.</paragraph><paragraph>The lordly armies camped at places where the summoned national militia, reinforcements, or allies gradually gathered. The longest encampments (sometimes lasting several months) occurred during the <accent>siege of fortresses</accent> or on riverbanks, where an enemy army waited on the other side.</paragraph><paragraph>Tents were intentionally set up close to each other for security (like walls). The first and largest tent in the centre of the camp belonged to the commander, and the tents nearby to nobles and high-ranking soldiers. Simple shelters for soldiers and horses surrounded these. The army could camp separately in several locations. Larger camps often included a field chapel, a place for treating the wounded, or an improvised brothel.</paragraph><paragraph>Long-term camping was more challenging due to the need for supplies, which were always provided by administrators of nearby affiliated townships. If the army was on enemy territory, <italic>foraging units</italic> were sent out to find food and wood. If supplies were insufficient, they had to move or abandon the campaign.</paragraph><paragraph>It was difficult to maintain adequate <accent>hygiene</accent> and <accent>morale</accent> in the camp. Soldiers were threatened by epidemics, mutual quarrels, and fights. Disputes were strictly judged to maintain order.</paragraph><paragraph>中世纪时，乡下经常会有抢劫的士兵、强盗和卫军路过，他们一般是以人数不一的小组活动，但也有单打独斗的，后者会经常改换住所。他们住在火堆边的临时建造的小屋、窝棚或帐篷里。有些人连续很多天都住在同一顶帐篷里，也有人支起帐篷只住一晚，第二天继续出发。</paragraph><paragraph>他们为营地<accent>选择合适地址</accent>时主要考虑水源、食物、动物饲料和木柴。他们极少会在村子里和城堡附近扎营，那是给贵族和随从们过夜准备的。战时或在赶路时，他们也会露天睡觉，因为没有搭建和拆除营地的时间。</paragraph><paragraph>贵族的军队会在民兵的集结地，或是增援部队与盟友集合的地方扎营。在<accent>围攻堡垒</accent>，或与敌人隔岸对峙时，扎营的时间是最久的，有时会长达几个月。</paragraph><paragraph>为安全起见，人们扎帐篷的时候会有意识地靠近（模仿城垛）。营地中心最大的帐篷是指挥官的，它附近的帐篷则是给贵族和高阶士兵准备的，周围的简单窝棚和小屋就是给普通士兵和他们的马住的了。扎营的时候没有必要都待在一起，一支军队可以分散在几个不同的地点扎营。如果是大规模的军营，还会配有一个战地礼拜堂，一个照顾伤员的医务室，有时甚至还有个临时妓院。 </paragraph><paragraph>长时间扎营时经常会面临后勤问题。而补给的重任会落到附近附属乡镇的行政人员头上。如果军队驻扎在敌方的土地上，就会派出<italic>征收部队</italic>去设法搜集食物和燃料。当物资短缺时，要么就搬到其他地方去，要么就只能放弃这场战役。</paragraph><paragraph>保持军营的<accent>卫生</accent>和<accent>士气</accent>是个难点，大量聚集在一起的士兵往往面临着流行病，和随时升级为打斗的争吵的威胁。因此，为了维护军营秩序，发生争执将会面临严厉惩罚。</paragraph>
ui_codex_cont_towns<paragraph>In the Middle Ages, the merchant settlements and villages on major trade routes or around castles became the first towns. They were founded by specialised entrepreneurs, the so-called <italic>locators</italic>. Their task was to seek out settlers, prepare and apportion land and build a community.</paragraph><paragraph>The ruler set down the rights and obligations concerning the locators and settlers, e.g. the level and method of collecting taxes and benefits, town privilege rules of self-government (capital justice rights), trading (market rights and 'one-mile' selling rights) and brewing and handling beer (brewing rights). Newly established settlements and cities were often exempt from taxes for a certain period (lhůta) from which is derived the name of many Czech villages, <italic>Lhota</italic>).</paragraph><paragraph>Towns were of different types; royal, seigneurial, mining and dowry (which belonged to the Queen). Seigneurial towns were divided into ecclesiastical, secular (feudal) and those of the Royal Chamber.</paragraph><paragraph>Apart from the feudal settlements, towns were mostly rectangular in layout with streets perpendicular to a central square featuring a Town Hall, market and a church. Until the 14th century, the main streets and squares of the largest towns remained unpaved (uncobbled).</paragraph><paragraph>Waste was emptied directly into the street or thrown into waste pits dug around the houses, despite the fact that sanitation had existed since antiquity. Gutters of rammed earth carried sewage and rainwater alongside the streets and an unpleasant smell hovered over the towns. Settlements were surrounded by wooden palisades, and from the second half of the 13th century, walls, which had to have at least two gates.</paragraph><paragraph>中世纪时，最早的一批城镇是由商人的定居地、主要贸易路线上和城堡周围的村庄演变而成的。它们由一批专门的土地开发者（<italic>“拓殖者”</italic>）创立。他们会招募移民，开发、分配土地，并建立社区。</paragraph><paragraph>统治者规定了拓殖者和定居者的权利与义务，如征税与利益收取的标准与方式、城镇特权（如自治权、司法权）、贸易（如市场权和“一英里”销售权）以及酿酒与啤酒管理（如酿酒权）等。新建立的定居点和城市常常在一定时期内免税（称为lhuta），因此许多捷克村庄的名字都叫做 <italic>
ui_codex_cont_trosecke_rybniky<paragraph>Today, there is a system of several ponds around the Trosky Castle. Although they were built in the 16th century, we decided to leave them in place because of the amazing views that their surroundings offer.</paragraph><paragraph>The largest of the ponds is the Rocktower Pond, which covers an area of 9 hectares, the others are Vidlák, Rokytňák, Kerchak, Hrudka and Lower Pond. In the Middle Ages, Nebakov Fortress stood near Nebakov Pond.</paragraph><paragraph>The area is now a nature reserve, called Podtrosecká Valley. It is the largest complex of wetland habitats in the Bohemian Paradise region and is home to many species of strictly protected organisms. If you ever decide to visit Trosky Castle, we recommend you stop by this nearby locality as well.</paragraph><paragraph>现如今，特罗斯基城堡周边有一系列池塘。虽然它们修建于16世纪，但我们还是决定将其保留，只因它们周边的景色极为宜人。</paragraph><paragraph>其中最大的就是石塔池塘，占地面积达9公顷，余下的则有维德拉克池塘、罗基特纳池塘、科尔察克池塘、赫鲁德卡池塘，以及下池塘。中世纪时期，内巴科夫城堡就坐落在内巴科夫池塘附近。</paragraph><paragraph>那片区域现如今已成为了一处名叫波德特罗谢茨卡河谷的自然保护区，它是“波希米亚乐园”地区最大的一片湿地栖息地群，也是许多受到严格保护的物种的家园。如果你有机会游览特罗斯基城堡，我们建议你也拜访一下位于其附近的该自然保护区。</paragraph>
ui_codex_cont_troskovice<heading>Troskowitz</heading><paragraph>The first mention is found in 1388 in connection with the nearby castle, but the village probably existed long before that. The village got its name from the rock on which the castle was later built, as the rock resembled the ruins of a castle from a distance.</paragraph><heading>Tachov</heading><paragraph>A small village 1.5 km north of Troskowitz, first mentioned in sources in 1388. A nameless stream flows through it, emptying into the Krčák pond, forming cascades along the way and a waterfall about 10 metres high.</paragraph><paragraph>Today, the village is part of a protected area and the <italic>'Golden Trail of the Bohemian Paradise'</italic> passes through it.</paragraph><heading>Zhelejov</heading><paragraph>There are only a few mentions of Zhelejov. Notably, in 1558, the three sons of Lord Semine sold the fortress and the village to the 'Skalské panství'. The fortress was abandoned during the wars with the Swedes.</paragraph><heading>特罗斯科维茨</heading><paragraph>与此村庄有关的记载最早可追溯到1388年，它与附近的城堡有所关联，但是村庄似乎很早之前就已存在。这座村庄的名字源自日后拔地而起的城堡身下的岩石，因为从远处望去，那些岩石看似如同一座城堡废墟。</paragraph><heading>塔霍夫</heading><paragraph>这是一座位于特罗斯科维茨北边1.5公里处的小村落，于1388年首次出现于史料之中。一条无名河流途经村庄，最终注入克尔恰克（Krcák）池塘，沿途还形成了诸多小型瀑布和一个约10米高的大瀑布。</paragraph><paragraph>如今，该村庄被纳入了保护区的管辖当中，<italic>“波希米亚乐园黄金小经”（Golden Trail of the Bohemian Paradise）</italic>便经过那里。</paragraph><heading>哲勒约夫</heading><paragraph>与哲勒约夫相关的记录并不多，主要发现在1558年。当时塞米领主的三个儿子将堡垒和村庄出售给了“岩石领地”（Skalské panství），而后在与瑞典人的战争期间，该堡垒遭到了遗弃。</paragraph>
ui_codex_cont_unos_prokopa<paragraph>At the turn of the 14th and 15th centuries Moravia was plagued by wars between the brothers <accent>Prokop</accent> and <accent>Jobst</accent> of Luxembourg. At issue was the legacy and power of a dynasty that had aspired to the Polish and Hungarian Crowns. After the death of Charles IV, both brothers supported the policies of Hungarian King Sigismund, but when he imprisoned King Wenceslas IV in 1394, Prokop sided with the Bohemian King. In return he was granted the right to occupy episcopal castles which led to his excommunication by the Pope and his subsequent capture by Sigismund.
ui_codex_cont_unosy_vaclava<paragraph>Wenceslas IV was not a very capable ruler. During his reign, he was kidnapped several times in an attempt to remove him from power.</paragraph><paragraph><accent>The first time</accent> he was captured in Königshof near Beroun in 1394 and taken to Wildberg Castle (Upper Austria). The abduction was carried out by the oposition nobles, the so-called <accent>League of Lords</accent>.</paragraph></paragraph>In 1402, Wenceslas' brother, King Sigismund of Hungary, who aspired to the Bohemian throne with the support of the high nobility, imprisoned his brother <accent>a second time</accent>. Wenceslas was taken to Vienna, from where he managed to escape in November 1403 with the help of allied lords.</paragraph><paragraph>In the meantime, however, Sigismund managed to impose higher taxes on both towns and monasteries. The towns that refused to submit to him were conquered and plundered. The conflict escalated into a long civil war, which did not subside even after Wenceslas' death.</paragraph> <paragraph>作为统治者，瓦茨拉夫四世能力有所欠缺。他在统治期间，瓦茨拉夫四世多次遭遇以篡权为目的的绑架事件。</paragraph><paragraph><accent>首次绑架</accent>发生在1394年，地点是贝龙附近的凯尼希霍夫，他被关押在上奥地利的维德伯格城堡。这次绑架是由反对派贵族，即所谓的<accent>领主联盟</accent>实施的。</paragraph><paragraph>1402年，瓦茨拉夫的兄弟、匈牙利国王西格斯蒙德，在高贵阶层的簇拥下，为争夺波西米亚的王位，再次将瓦茨拉夫囚禁。这次，瓦茨拉夫四世被囚禁在维也纳，但在1403年11月，他在盟友贵族的协助下成功脱逃。</paragraph><paragraph>然而，与此同时，西格斯蒙德对城镇和修道院加征了重税。那些拒绝服从的城镇遭到了攻占和掠夺。这场冲突逐渐演变为一场旷日持久的内战，甚至在瓦茨拉夫四世去世后也未能平息。</paragraph>
ui_codex_cont_vojenske_lezeni<paragraph>European medieval armies were based on the feudal obligation of nobles to serve their liege lord. This system, which originated from late Roman traditions, primarily applied to defensive warfare where there was no opportunity for plunder. If a ruler wanted to lead an offensive campaign, he had to not only promise his knights the prospect of loot but also pay them.</paragraph><paragraph>In France and Italy, where wars were relatively frequent, mercenary armed bands (<italic>rutta</italic>, <italic>routes</italic>) known as <accent>free companies</accent> began to emerge. These companies fought for wages during wars but extorted protection money from peasants and robbed travellers during peacetime.</paragraph><paragraph>In the 14th century, mercenary service became a profession for thousands of impoverished nobles. Among the largest groups were the French <italic>Bandes blanches</italic>, the English <italic>White Company</italic>, and the Italian <italic>Compagnia di San Giorgio</italic>. In Bohemia, there was the retinue surrounding Jan Sokol of Lamberk and Hynek I of Kunstadt.</paragraph><paragraph>欧洲中世纪的军队建立在贵族对其封主的封建义务之上。这一制度源自于罗马帝国末期的传统，主要适用于无法进行劫掠的防御性战争。倘若统治者想要发动进攻性战役，他不仅要向骑士们允诺战利品，还得给他们支付报酬。</paragraph><paragraph>在法国和意大利，战争相对频繁，以<accent>自由联队</accent>著称的雇佣兵团体（<italic>rutta</italic>，<italic>routes</italic>）开始涌现。这些团体会在战乱期间为报酬参与到战争当中，而在和平时期又会向农民勒索保护费，或是抢劫过往旅者。</paragraph><paragraph>在14世纪，数千名穷困潦倒的贵族走上了成为职业雇佣兵的道路。其中最大的兵团有：法国的<italic>白衣团</italic>（Bandes blanches），英国的<italic>白公司</italic>（White Company），以及意大利的<italic>圣乔治公司</italic>（Compagnia di San Giorgio）。在波希米亚，就曾有围绕在扬·索科尔和海尼克一世身边的随从。</paragraph>
ui_codex_cont_winegrower<paragraph>In Bohemia, viticulture began spreading from the 10th century onwards, primarily for liturgical purposes. Between the 11th and 13th centuries, vineyards were established mainly by monasteries and the nobility in locations similar to those where grapes are grown today, especially in southern Moravia. While the favorable climate initially allowed grape cultivation even in Bohemia, a later period of global cooling caused the vines to die off.</paragraph><paragraph>Caring for grapevines occupied winemakers throughout the year, with the harvest traditionally taking place from October to November, depending on the weather. Grapes were typically cultivated in areas unsuitable for other crops, such as rocky southern slopes. Establishing a new vineyard could take three to four years, with optimal productivity lasting around thirty to forty years</paragraph><paragraph>The harvested grapes were collected and then poured into vats, where they were crushed by foot. White grapes were immediately pressed and stored in wooden, pitch-sealed, and sulfurised barrels where fermentation took place. Red grapes were crushed, destemmed, and left to ferment in open vats with regular stirring. This produced a substance known as "must," which was pressed after a few days, and the entire mixture was then transferred to barrels.</paragraph><paragraph></paragraph><paragraph>A great lover of wine was King Charles IV, who imported cultivation methods and certain grape varieties from France and granted numerous privileges to winemakers.</paragraph><paragraph>在波西米亚，由于礼拜仪式的原因，从10世纪开始就有了种植酿酒葡萄的习惯。在11到13世纪间，葡萄园主要为修道院和贵族服务，它们的位置和今天的葡萄园的位置很相近，主要都在南摩拉维亚。由于当时适宜的气候条件，葡萄园曾经在波西米亚繁荣发展过一段时间，但后来因为全球变冷绝迹了。</paragraph><paragraph>照看酿酒葡萄是很麻烦的，葡萄酒商一年到头都十分繁忙。收获的季节是十月到十一月，具体时间由气候决定。酿酒葡萄一般都种在不适合种其他植物的地方，例如多石的向南山坡上。建立一个葡萄园可能要花三四年，然后就能维持三四十年。</paragraph><paragraph>葡萄采摘下来之后会放进大桶里，人们用踩踏的方式把葡萄碾碎。白葡萄在碾碎后会立刻榨汁，把葡萄汁存放在木桶里，用硫磺保持卫生，并用沥青封口发酵。而红葡萄在碾碎之后要先去籽，然后放在开口的桶里发酵，并定时搅拌，这样制成的是所谓的“酿酒渣”，要在几天后将其压榨，将榨出的果汁倒入桶中保存。</paragraph><paragraph>国王查理四世相当爱酒，他从法国进口了酿酒葡萄以及种植技术，还给了酿酒商不少特权。</paragraph>
ui_codex_cont_zbroj<paragraph>In the 14th century, manufacturing capabilities expanded, leading to the production of stronger and often combined armours. Older chainmail armours transitioned to plate armour due to advancements in steel processing and the ability to forge larger pieces of metal on automatic hammers. Soldiers' heads were protected by helmets such as the cervelliere (known as the "iron hat"), bascinets, and helms.</paragraph> <paragraph>Armours were crafted by armourers or helmet makers, typically from a single piece of hardened plate (skull caps, bascinets) or riveted together from several smaller pieces (cervelliere, sallet). The finest armour of the early 15th century was considered that made in German and Italian lands. "Combined type" armours were used by heavy cavalry - they consisted of chainmail supplemented with plate armour covering the limbs and simpler forms of cuirasses, plate coats, or quilted jackets. Some plate coats and breastplates were equipped with a hook for the knight's spear. If the armour lacked a hook, the spear was inserted into a slot in the shield, which covered the left arm controlling the reins and the lower part of the helmet.</paragraph> <paragraph>A widely used helmet was the bascinet (sallet) with a distinctly shaped visor nicknamed the "dog snout." Additionally, iron hats with one or two eye slots are frequently depicted in visual sources. Shoulders were protected either by chainmail sleeves or small pauldrons. An indispensable part of the armour was the shield.</paragraph><paragraph>14世纪时，制造业的发展使得人们可以锻造更强韧的、组合式的盔甲。由于炼钢技术的改进，以及锻造更大金属块的能力，旧式链甲过渡了到板甲。士兵的头部由头盔提供保护：例如圆形钢盔（被称作“铁帽”）、中头盔或者大头盔。 </paragraph> <paragraph>盔甲是由板甲匠和盔匠制造的，通常是使用一片回火过的金属（例如无边帽、中头盔），或由几块较小的钢板铆接而成（例如圆形钢盔和大头盔）。15世纪早期时，公认的最好的盔甲是德国和意大利制造的。</paragraph> <paragraph>组合铠甲是重骑兵使用的——它由链甲和覆盖四肢的板甲构成，还包括一个简化的胸甲或软甲（绗缝过的罩衣）。有些胸甲和软甲上带有钩子，用来在战斗中支撑骑士的长矛或长枪。如果盔甲上没有钩子，长矛或长枪就嵌在盾上的凹槽里。盾是用来遮挡头盔的下半部分以及控制缰绳的左臂的。中头盔（Sallet）是一种常见的头盔，有一个形状明显的面罩，绰号 "狗鼻子"。还有，不少图像资料中还经常出现带有一个或两个眼槽的铁帽。肩部由链甲袖或护肩保护。盔甲的另一个重要组成部分是盾。</paragraph>
ui_codex_cont_zebraci<paragraph>Although beggars were on the fringes of society, they held an indelible place in it. In cities, there were hospitals designated for them and the Church also provided assistance. <accent>Begging</accent> was allowed at cemetery gates and in front of churches, and each beggar could occasionally visit baths at municipal expense.</paragraph><paragraph>Some monks regularly begged too – called <italic>almsmen</italic> or <italic>mendicants</italic>. The beggars were well-known and tolerated in their communities, but by contrast, it was believed that foreign and wandering beggars brought misfortune.</paragraph><paragraph>There was seldom any shortage of alms, because charity and gifts to the poor were considered prerequisites for salvation.</paragraph><paragraph>尽管乞丐一直处在社会的边缘地位，但他们也是社会不可分离的一部分。城市中有专门为他们设立的医院，教会也为他们提供援助。墓地门前和教堂门前允许乞讨。此外，乞丐还能享受市政资助，偶尔去洗个澡。</paragraph><paragraph>有些僧人也会行乞化缘，被称为行脚僧或托钵僧。街坊邻居们都很熟悉这些乞丐们，也能与他们和平共处，但同时人们也认为外来的乞丐会带来厄运。</paragraph><paragraph>乞丐从来不乏其物，慈善和救济穷人是通往救赎的敲门砖。</paragraph>
ui_codex_cont_zlata_doba_karla<paragraph>When Charles, the young son of John of Luxembourg, inherited the title Margrave of Moravia and subsequently the Bohemian throne, the kingdom began to flourish not only economically but also culturally. This period is now known as <italic>"the Golden Age"</italic>.</paragraph><paragraph>During his reign, many cities, towns and castles received new fortifications, new bridges and better infrastructure, as well as new churches. Many famous buildings are named after Charles because he initiated their construction, such as Charles Bridge, Karlstejn Castle and one of the oldest universities in Europe, Charles University in Prague, which he founded in 1348.</paragraph><paragraph>He also emphasised the role of faith in society. He was instrumental in the renewal of the cults of Saints Wenceslas, Sigismund and Vitus, to whom he dedicated sacred buildings, including the cathedral at Prague Castle.</paragraph><paragraph>He used marriage policy to strengthen his position in Europe, linking his family with prominent houses in neighbouring countries. He influenced the appointment of ecclesiastical offices. Thanks to his firm rule and a policy based on alliances, he was able to maintain peace in Europe.</paragraph><paragraph>King Charles was an educated ruler with an interest in the arts, which was reflected in the architecture of the cities, especially Prague, which he chose as the seat of his court and which went through a considerable transformation during his reign.</paragraph><paragraph>卢森堡的约翰的小儿子查理继承了摩拉维亚侯爵的爵位，随后又继承了波希米亚王位。自此，国家的经济和文化开始繁荣发展，这个时期便是至今都为人熟知的<italic>“黄金时期”</italic>。</paragraph><paragraph>在查理统治期间，许多城镇与城堡建起崭新的防御工事、桥梁、基础设施以及教堂。查理本人乃建设的发起者，因此很多著名建筑均以其名命名，比如查理大桥、卡尔施泰因城堡（Karlstejn Castle），以及欧洲最古老的大学之一，也就是位于布拉格、建于1348年的查理大学。</paragraph><paragraph>查理四世还热衷于强调信仰在社会中的重要地位。他致力于重燃人们对圣瓦茨拉夫、圣西格斯蒙德以及圣维特的崇拜，他为这几位圣人兴建圣所，其中就包括建于布拉格城堡的大教堂。</paragraph><paragraph>为了巩固他在欧洲的地位，他利用政治联姻，促使自己和邻国的显赫家族建立了同盟关系。他对教会官职的委任颇具影响，且得益于坚决的执政风格和为联盟颁布的政策，他才得以维护欧洲的和平。 </paragraph><paragraph>查理是个受过良好教育的君主，对艺术兴趣颇深， 这些特点也反映在了城市的建筑之上，尤其是布拉格。他将那里选作王都，布拉格在他的统治期间经历了翻天覆地的变化。</paragraph>
ui_codex_katerina<paragraph>The brave and determined helper of Jan Zizka of Trotznov is mostly just a fictional character, although women bearing this name played important roles in Zizka's life.</paragraph><paragraph>The first Katherine was probably his mother, although this is not certain, as other sources name her Johanna. We know more about the second Katherine. In the provincial land-registry books we learn that Jan Zizka married her and acquired a farm in Čerejov as a dowry. They even had a daughter, although her name is unknown.</paragraph><paragraph>After Katherine's death, Zizka married… yet another Katherine. Again, we do not know anything about her, except that Zizka inherited her property after her death.</paragraph><paragraph>In view of the importance of this name in the life of this great figure of Czech history, we decided to interpret the character of Katherine in our own way.</paragraph><paragraph>扬·杰式卡手下那位英勇决绝的女性助手很大程度上不过是个虚构角色。不过，拥有该名字的女性在杰式卡的一生中扮演着极为重要的角色。</paragraph><paragraph>我们所了解的第一位名为“凯瑟琳”的女士可能是杰式卡的母亲，但仍难以考证，因为其它资料所显示其母之名又为“约翰娜”。对于第二位名为“凯瑟琳”的女士，我们了解到的信息更多。通过翻阅省级土地登记簿，我们了解到，扬·杰式卡与这位女士缔结联姻，因此得到了一份嫁妆，即切雷约夫（Cerejov）的一间农场。两人甚至育有一女，但其名不详。</paragraph><paragraph>在凯瑟琳过世后，再婚的杰式卡……又一次迎娶了一位名为“凯瑟琳”的女士。同样，我们对这位女士所知甚少，只知道杰式卡在她离世后继承了她的财产。</paragraph><paragraph>对于杰式卡这位在捷克历史中颇具地位的伟人而言，如此姓名举足轻重，因此，我们决定以我们自己的方式塑造“凯瑟琳”这名角色。</paragraph>
ui_codex_oldrich_vavak<paragraph>Twice during his life, he was appointed Royal Mint Master, and after the outbreak of the Hussite uprising, he was one of the few representatives of the higher Czech nobility to join the rebels.</paragraph><paragraph>We know nothing about his life before the outbreak of the uprising, except that in the years 1402-1403 (or 1404), during King Wenceslas's absence from Bohemia, he held the office of Mint Master.</paragraph><paragraph>His later life is documented, during which he supported Jan Hus and complained to King Sigismund about his burning. He initiated the negotiations of the Four Articles of Prague (which defined the direction and demands of the uprising) and was elected as a representative of the nobility to the provisional government at the Congress of Tschaslau. He marched into battle alongside Jan Zizka, and in 1421, he became the Mint Master of Kuttenberg for the second time.</paragraph><paragraph>他一生两次被任命为皇家铸币官，在胡斯起义爆发后，他是少数几个加入叛乱者的捷克高级贵族。</paragraph><paragraph>我们对他在起义爆发前的经历知之甚少，只知道在1402年至1403年（或1404年）期间，在瓦茨拉夫国王未掌管波希米亚之时，他担任过铸币官。</paragraph><paragraph>但他的晚年经历却有详细记载。当时的他支持扬·胡斯，并向国王西格斯蒙德揭露了扬·胡斯被烧死一事。他曾发起对《布拉格四项条款》（the Four Articles of Prague）的商讨（该条款决定了起义的方向和要求），并在查斯劳大会（the Congress of Tschaslau）上被选为贵族代表，加入了临时政府。他曾与扬·杰式卡并肩作战，并于1421年在库滕堡第二次担任铸币官。</paragraph> Eventually, however, even Wenceslas IV ran out of patience and had Hynek imprisoned in 1407. He was soon released, but did not enjoy his freedom very long, for he died in 1408.</paragraph><paragraph>此人原名海尼克·耶维绍夫斯基·库斯塔特（Hynek Jevisovský of Kunstadt），他是一位勇猛无畏的战士，在摩拉维亚的边疆侯爵战争期间变成了一个臭名昭著的强盗骑士，并于1401与1402年频繁袭击奥地利，在波希米亚国王受囚禁于维也纳期间，他仍未罢休。</paragraph><paragraph>瓦茨拉夫四世国王逃脱后，奥地利公爵阿尔布雷希特才失去了耐心。1404年，他带领12000名战士，协同卢森堡的西格斯蒙德手下的12000兵力进军兹诺伊莫。但是，“酒鬼”提前得知了此消息。当敌军兵临城下，此时的城镇早已严加设防，且在盟友兰贝格的扬·索科尔的帮助下击退袭击。但值得注意的是，这场胜利很大程度上也得归功于在敌军阵营中传播蔓延的疾病痢疾，敌方贵族同样受到感染，奥德利的阿尔布雷希特四世还因此命丧黄泉。</paragraph><paragraph>于是，“酒鬼”继续干着劫掠的勾当。

ui_derivstat_dominate_descA way to get your way in conversations using your Charisma, often using threats and condescending behavior. People generally won't like you for it, but on the other hand, having a low reputation with them will help you succesfully Dominate them. The Domination stat is derived primarily from Charisma level, and to a lesser extent your Speech level.依仗你的魅力是在对话中达成目的一种手段，一般可对他人进行威胁或是表现得居高临下。通常来说，人们会对那样的行为嗤之以鼻，但从另一角度看，败坏的名声反而能让你成功地支配他人。支配的程度主要取决于你的魅力值水平，其次就是你的口才等级。
ui_derivstat_equipvisibVisibility可见度
ui_derivstat_equipvisib_desc<p>Visibility affects how far away you can be noticed from. The lower your visibility, the closer the observer has to be to see you. This is especially important when you're sneaking around or up to no good.</p><p>Visibility is calculated as the average of the visibility level of your outer layer of clothing. Shiny armour and brightly colored clothing are typically highly visible. Dark clothing, on the other hand, less so. Regardless of how you are dressed you're much easier to see in the light of day than when you're sneaking through the shadows or at night.</p><p>可见度决定了人们从多远的距离就能注意到你。你的可见度越低，他人就必须离你更近才能看得到你。此属性在你偷鸡摸狗或图谋不轨时尤为重要。</p><p>可见度根据你外层衣物的显眼度平均水平计算而得。耀眼盔甲和鲜艳衣物通常更为引人注目，而深色衣服则不会那么显眼。无论你如何打扮，与在阴影或暗夜下潜行相比，暴露在白天光线下更容易被人察觉。</p>
ui_derivstat_inventorycapacity_desc_hDetermines your horse's load capacity. Can be improved with a better saddle and saddlebags.将决定你的马匹负重能力。可以通过更好的马鞍和鞍袋升级
ui_derivstat_morale_desc_dYour dog's obedience level affects his behaviour. A dog with low obedience may not respond to all commands or may run off from time to time. On the other hand, a high obedience level means your dog will be stronger and more likely to obey your commands.狗狗的服从程度会影响它的行为。服从性低的狗可能不会回应所有命令，或者时不时会跑开。相反，服从性高的狗会更强壮，更可能遵守你的命令。

ui_helpoverlay_alchemy3_s0800<accent>Finish the potion by pouring it into the mortar and grinding it</accent><br/>Used to finish gunpowder<accent>将药剂倒入研钵并研磨，即可完成药剂</accent><br/>用于完成火药制作
ui_helpoverlay_alchemy5_s0200You can <strong>prepare the ingredients</strong> by opening your inventory and selecting them. You can have up to three types of herbs and three special ingredients. All of them are located <strong>to the right of the cauldron</strong>.<br/> <br/><accent>Herbs</accent><br/>You pick up herbs by the handful and can only take one handful at a time. After picking them up, you can toss them into the cauldron with the base poured over them, into the mortar, or into the storage bowl.<br/> <br/><accent>Special Ingredients</accent><br/>They behave just like herbs, except you can only have one of each. Some can't be ground in a mortar for obvious reasons.你可以打开物品栏并选择所需物品来进行<strong>材料准备</strong>。你最多可以选择三种草药和三种特殊材料，所有材料都位于<strong>大锅的右侧</strong>。<br/> <br/><accent>草药</accent><br/>你可以抓取草药，但一次只能拿一把。抓取草药后，你可以将其放入大锅中，与已倒入的液体底料混合，或是放入研钵或储存碗内。<br/> <br/><accent>特殊材料</accent><br/>特殊材料的使用方式与草药相同，只不过每种只能选择一个。有些材料很明显不能放在研钵中研磨。
ui_helpoverlay_alchemy5_s0600<label>Storage bowl</label><br/><light>You can put the necessary amount of herbs into the storage bowl, even ground, so that they can be added to the cauldron all at once.</light><label>储存碗</label><br/><light>你可以将所需数量的草药放入储存碗中，包括已研磨的草药，以便一次性将它们加入锅中。</light>
ui_helpoverlay_alchemy5_s0700<label>Mortar</label><br/><light>You can grind herbs and certain special ingredients in the mortar. First add the ingredients, then you can use the pestle to grind them in the mortar. You can also grind multiple ingredients at once, but you can't separate them.</light><label>研钵</label><br/><light>你可以在研钵中研磨草药和某些特殊材料。先将材料加入研钵，随后使用研棒进行研磨。你可以同时研磨多种材料，但无法将研磨好的材料再分开。</light>

ui_helpoverlay_barber_s0100For a small fee, you can have the barber change your hairstyle or trim your beard.只需支付少许费用，理发师便能为你变换发型或修剪胡须。
ui_helpoverlay_barber_s0200You can use the barber's services at <strong>the bathhouse by the Zhelejov wagoner's inn</strong> in the Trosky region or <strong>Adam's bathhouse</strong> in Kuttenberg. <strong>They're marked with an icon on your map.</strong>在特罗斯基地区的<strong>哲勒约夫马车夫驿站澡堂</strong>，或是库滕堡<strong>亚当的澡堂</strong>，你都能享受到理发师的服务。<strong>地图上可以找到澡堂的图标。</strong>
ui_helpoverlay_barber_s0300All barbers have <strong>the same prices and offers</strong>, though the price may be influenced by your reputation.所有理发师的<strong>收费与服务相同</strong>，不过，你的声望或许会影响最终价格。

ui_helpoverlay_blacksmithing0_s0100As the son of a blacksmith, Henry has learned a lot. With the right knowledge, skill and materials, he can forge axes, swords both long and short as well as hunting swords.身为铁匠之子，亨利自然也学了不少锻造知识。凭借锻造知识、手艺和材料，他就能打造出斧头、长短剑以及猎刀。

ui_helpoverlay_bows_s0100The bow is a quick and effective weapon at long range, but handling it requires training. Aiming can be difficult, as holding a bowstring drawn drains your stamina and as it depletes, your hands will start to shake.弓是种迅捷有效的远程利器，但是想熟练使用需要多加练习。拉弓瞄准可能会很难，因为拉紧弓弦会消耗你的耐力，而当耐力逐渐耗尽时，你的手也会颤抖起来。
ui_helpoverlay_combos0_s0300Holding down the block {button|button|button} will allow you <strong>block attacks from all opponents</strong> in front of you. However, a successful block costs <strong>stamina</strong>, so you'll be unable to defend yourself without it.按住格挡即可<strong>招架面前所有敌人的进攻</strong>。然而每次成功格挡都会消耗耐力 <strong>stamina</strong>，一旦耐力值消耗干净后，就无法有效抵御攻击。
ui_helpoverlay_combos1_s0100The most effective way to fight is to chain attacks into longer sequences and combos. For attacks to chain properly, they must be performed in quick succession. Make sure to attack again as soon as your strike lands!进行持续攻击以发动连击是最有效的一种战斗方式。要发动连击，就需要连续进行攻击，确保每次攻击都应在上一次攻击命中对手前发动！
ui_helpoverlay_combos2_s0100<accent>Stamina</accent><br/>Attacks that don't pierce your opponent's armour will <strong>reduce their stamina</strong>. Once they're out of stamina, they'll start taking damage to their health.<br/> <br/>A Perfect block doesn't cost any stamina. Sometimes it comes in handy to only <strong>defend using Perfect blocks</strong> without performing ripostes, and thus <strong>regenerate your stamina</strong>.<accent>耐力</accent><br/>当攻击无法穿透对手的护甲时，就会转而<strong>消耗对手的耐力</strong>。一旦对手的耐力耗尽，他们此后受到攻击时就会开始损失生命值。<br/> <br/>由于完美格挡不会消耗耐力，因此<strong>只用完美格挡防御</strong>但不进行反击，<strong>从而恢复耐力，</strong>也是一种可行的策略。
ui_helpoverlay_crime_s1300<label>Pillory</label><label>颈手枷</label>
ui_helpoverlay_crime_s1400You'll spend a few days in the pillory, and the public humiliation will make it temporarily difficult for you to deal with people.你将在几天内被套上颈手枷，示众羞辱的状态也会让你暂时难以处理人际关系。
ui_helpoverlay_dice2_s0200If you and your opponent have a badge of the same level (<strong>tin</strong>, <strong>silver</strong> or <strong>gold</strong>), you can make use of them during your game.<br/> <br/>Every badge has a different property that affect the rules of the game.<br/> <br/>You can find these properties in the badge's description in your inventory, or you can read them at any time on the following page.</strong>如果你和对手拥有相同级别的徽章（<strong>锡</strong>、<strong>银</strong>或<strong>金</strong>），你们就可以在游戏中使用。<br/> <br/>每种徽章都有不同的效果，会影响游戏规则。<br/> <br/>你可以在物品栏中查看每种徽章的描述，也可以随时在以下页面中了解。</strong>
ui_helpoverlay_dice5_s0000Dice: Gold badges (4/4)骰子：金制徽章（4/4）
ui_helpoverlay_dice5_s1300<accent>Gold badge of transmutation</accent><accent>金制转化徽章</accent>
ui_helpoverlay_dice5_s1900<accent>Gold badge of resurrection</accent><accent>金制重生徽章</accent>
ui_helpoverlay_dlc_barber_s0100Bathhouses in the Kingdom of Bohemia are regarded not only for their beautiful bathmaids, but also their skilled barbers that can turn any common vagrant into a dashing cavalier. For a small fee, of course. 波希米亚王国的澡堂不仅以美貌的女工闻名，更因技艺高超的理发师能将平凡的流浪汉变身为英俊骑士而著称。当然，这一切都得付出相应的费用。
ui_helpoverlay_dlc_barber_s0200<accent>You gain:</accent><accent>你获得了：</accent>
ui_helpoverlay_dlc_barber_s0300<strong>New hair and beard styles for Henry</strong><strong>亨利的新发型和胡须样式</strong>
ui_helpoverlay_dlc_barber_s0400<strong>The option to change your appearance</strong><strong>更改外貌的选项</strong>
ui_helpoverlay_dlc_barber_s0500<strong>A bonus to your Charisma after every visit to the barber</strong><strong>每次拜访理发师后获得魅力加成</strong>
ui_helpoverlay_dlc_barber_s0600You can use the barber's services at the bathhouse by the Zhelejov wagoner's inn or Adam's bathhouse in Kuttenberg. These are marked with an icon on your map.你可以在哲勒约夫马车夫驿站的澡堂，或库滕堡亚当的澡堂获得理发师的服务。你可以在地图上找到这些澡堂的图标。
ui_helpoverlay_guns_s0000Handgonne手铳
ui_helpoverlay_guns_s0100The handgonne is a terrifying modern weapon. Its slow loading speed and innaccurate aim are balanced by its sheer destructive force and the fear it causes amongst enemies.手铳是种可怕的现代武器。虽然装弹速度缓慢且瞄准精度差，但所具备的强大破坏力以及可对敌人造成的威慑足以弥补它的缺陷。
ui_helpoverlay_guns_s0300Hold $gun_prepare~; <strong>to load pistole</strong>长按$gun_prepare~;<strong>装填手铳</strong>
ui_helpoverlay_hc_basicCombat_s0300When in combat, your cursor will lock onto your opponent. This allows you to select one of four attack zones. In <strong>Hardcore mode</strong>, you can tell which attack zone you have selected based on <strong>the position of your character's hands</strong>.<br/> <br/>When using a sword, the top and side zones are used for slashing attacks and the bottom zone for stabs. Blunt and polearm weapons only use the top and side zones. When unarmed, the side zones are used for punches and the bottom zone is for kicks.在战斗中，你的光标会锁定在对手身上。此时，你可以在四个区域中选择一个进行攻击。在<strong>硬核模式</strong>下，你可以通过观察<strong>角色手臂的位置</strong>来判断当前所选的攻击区域。<br/> <br/>使用剑时，顶部和侧面区域用于劈砍，底部区域用于刺击。钝器和长柄武器则只使用顶部和侧面区域进行攻击。赤手空拳时，侧面区域为出拳攻击，底部区域则为踢腿攻击。
ui_helpoverlay_hc_combos0_s0600If instead of holding down the block button you press it at the start of your opponent's attack, you'll perform a perfect block, which will interrupt your opponent and allow you to follow up with a riposte.如果你在对手攻击开始的瞬间迅速按下格挡键，而不是一直按住不放，就能触发完美格挡，从而打断对手的攻击并获得反击的机会。
ui_helpoverlay_hc_combos0_s0800To perform a riposte, press the attack button as soon as you interrupt your opponent with a perfect block.要进行反击，只需在完美格挡打断对手的瞬间按下攻击按钮即可。
ui_helpoverlay_hc_combos1_s0210<label>In Hardcore mode, you can't see your combat rosette, so you'll have to pay attention to your weapon's position.</label><label>在硬核模式下，你无法看到自己的战斗准星花纹，因此必须格外注意武器的位置。</label>
ui_helpoverlay_hc_horse0_s1100<accent>Horses in Hardcore mode</accent><br/>In Hardcore mode, you can't see your horse's stamina bar or speed indicator, so you'll have to pay close attention to its behaviour. When it gets tired, it will whinny in discomfort and shake its head.<accent>硬核模式下的马匹</accent><br/>在硬核模式下，你看不到马的耐力条或速度指示器，因此必须仔细观察它的行为。当马感到疲惫时，它会因不适而嘶鸣并摇头。
ui_helpoverlay_HcMode_s0000Welcome to Hardcore mode!欢迎游玩硬核模式！
ui_helpoverlay_HcMode_s0100Hardcore mode is an immersive gameplay mode which mainly influences your user interface and the way you navigate the world.硬核模式是一种沉浸式的游戏体验模式，主要影响你的用户界面以及探索游戏世界的方式。
ui_helpoverlay_HcMode_s0200<accent>Negative perks</accent><br/>In Hardcore mode, the difficulty of the game is influenced by the negative perks you've chosen. You can see their effect any time in the character tab under your main level.<accent>负面特性</accent><br/>在硬核模式下，游戏的难度受你选择的负面特性的影响。你可以随时在角色选项单的主等级下方查看负面特性的效果。
ui_helpoverlay_HcMode_s0300<accent>Navigation</accent><br/>In Hardcore mode, <strong>you can't see cardinal directions</strong> on your compass, and <strong>quest markers</strong> only appear when you're close enough to them.<accent>探索</accent><br/>在硬核模式下，指南针<strong>将不再显示方向</strong>，<strong>任务标记</strong>只有在接近目标时才会显现。
ui_helpoverlay_HcMode_s0400You can't see your position on the map, so you'll have to use your surroundings to find your way around. If you're lost, you can always ask someone where you are. Just walk up to them, use $chat_focus_follow_init_press~; and ask. <strong>That is, if you didn't choose the Bashful perk of course!</strong>你无法在地图上看到你的位置，因此你必须依靠周围环境来判断方向。如果你迷路了，不妨找人问问。靠近他们，按下$chat_focus_follow_init_press~来询问。<strong>当然，如果你选择了害羞这个特性就另当别论了！</strong>
ui_helpoverlay_HcMode_s0500<accent>Combat and survival</accent><br/>Your <strong>health and stamina bars</strong> are hidden in Hardcore mode, and you have to rely on sight and sound to orientate yourself on the battlefield. When your opponent is injured, he'll be bloodied. If he's tired, he'll breathe heavily. The same goes for your character!<br/> <br/>In combat, you <strong>don't see your combat rosette</strong> or <strong>perfect block and riposte indicators</strong>. You have to rely on you and your opponent's movements.<accent>战斗与生存</accent><br/>在硬核模式下，你的<strong>生命值和耐力条</strong>将不再显示，你在战场上需要依靠视觉和听觉来做出判断。对手受伤时会浑身是血，疲惫时会大口喘气。你的角色也是如此！<br/> <br/>在战斗中，<strong>战斗准星花纹</strong>、<strong>完美格挡指示器还有反击指示器都将消失</strong>，你只能依靠自己和对手的动作来判断。
ui_helpoverlay_HcMode_s0600<accent>Audentes Fortuna Iuvat!</accent><accent>Audentes Fortuna Iuvat（命运会眷顾勇敢之人）！</accent>
ui_helpoverlay_hcPerks_s0000Your journey begins…你的旅程即将启程……
ui_helpoverlay_hcPerks_s0100Henry, setting forth towards new lands by Hans Capon's side, isn't the lad he used to be. His adventurous life has taken a toll on him.亨利与汉斯·卡蓬一同，踏上了前往新土地的征途，他已不再是昔日的少年。冒险生活在他身上留下了深深的烙印。
ui_helpoverlay_hcPerks_s0200<strong>Hardcore mode is a more difficult and immersive way of experiencing the game. Helpful UI elements are limited both in and out of combat, and navigating the world relies solely on your sense of direction. Your character's position is never marked on the map, the compass doesn't show you cardinal directions, and fast travel is disabled. </strong><br/> <br/><strong>You can also adjust the difficulty in different areas by selecting at least three negative perks that will remain active throughout the game:</strong><strong>硬核模式是一种更具挑战性和沉浸感的游戏模式。用户界面的辅助功能大幅简化，无论是在战斗中还是探索世界时，你都得依靠自己的感官来判断形势。你的角色位置将不再标记在地图上，指南针不再会显示方向，而快速旅行功能也将禁用。</strong><br/> <br/><strong>你还可以通过选择至少三个负面特性来调整不同方面的游戏难度，这些负面特性将在整个游戏旅程中始终伴随着你：</strong>
ui_helpoverlay_hc_qam_use_s0610<label>In Hardcore mode, your belt and pouch aren't visible until they're in use..</label><label>在硬核模式下，你的腰带和口袋在不使用时是不可见的。</label>
ui_helpoverlay_horse0_s0300A horse can travel at three speeds: <strong>Trot</strong>, <strong>canter</strong> and <strong>gallop</strong>. Just spur it on and it will speed up. You can see what speed you're riding at by the icon above your stamina bar.马能以三种步态行进：<strong>小跑</strong>，<strong>慢跑</strong>和</strong>疾驰</strong>。鞭策马匹可让它加速。你可以通过耐力条上方的图标看到当前的骑行速度。
ui_helpoverlay_inventory1_s1600<label>Current encumbrance/capacity</label><label>当前负重/最大负重</label>
ui_helpoverlay_inventory1_s2400<label>Helmet padding</label><label>头巾</label>
ui_helpoverlay_inventory1_s2500<label>Neck guard</label><label>领圈</label>
ui_helpoverlay_inventory1_s2900<label>Chest plate</label><label>板甲</label>
ui_helpoverlay_inventory1_s3500<label>Coat</label><label>外套</label>
ui_helpoverlay_inventory1_s3600<label>Shirts</label><label>链甲</label>
ui_helpoverlay_inventory1_s3700<label>Arm armour</label><label>臂袖</label>
ui_helpoverlay_inventory1_s3800<label>Leg armour</label><label>护腿</label>
ui_helpoverlay_inventory2_s0300You must always wear additional head protection under your helmet, such as a coif or hood. The helmet itself will protect you from being cut, while the protection undernearth absorbs heavy impacts.头盔下应始终穿戴额外的头部防护，如链甲兜帽或头巾。这类防护能防止割伤，同时提供缓冲以吸收重击。
ui_helpoverlay_RPG_s0200Throughout the game, you'll earn "<strong>Perk Points</strong>" which you can use to improve your <strong>Stats</strong>, <strong>Skills</strong> and <strong>Warfare</strong> capabilities.<br/> <br/>In the other tabs, you'll find <strong>Buffs</strong> that can temporarily affect Henry's status, your <strong>Reputation</strong> in places you've been, recall <strong>Combos</strong>, or check the status of your <strong>Animal Companions</strong>.在游戏中，你可以获得“<strong>天赋点</strong>”，并以此来提升你的<strong>属性</strong>、<strong>技能</strong>和<strong>战斗</strong>。<br/> <br/>在其它标签内，你可以找到可短暂提升亨利属性的<strong>增益效果</strong>，还可了解你在曾抵达之地的<strong>声誉</strong>，也可复习发动过的<strong>连招</strong>，或者查看<strong>动物伙伴</strong>的状态。
ui_helpoverlay_skillcheck0_s0000Persuasion (1/2)说服（1/2）
ui_helpoverlay_skillcheck0_s1400<strong>The Persuasion skill is influenced by your other Stats and Skills. You can find detailed descriptions in your inventory, under the Player tab.</strong><strong>你的说服技能受其它属性和技能的影响。你可以在玩家标签的状态栏下看到详细描述。</strong>
ui_helpoverlay_skillcheck1_s0000Persuasion (2/2)说服（2/2）
ui_helpoverlay_skillcheck1_s0500<strong>Persuasion is not about picking the highest number, it's about who you're talking to, what you look like, what your reputation is. For example, threatening a bunch of thugs with violence alone is usually pointless, just like claiming to be a nobleman with straw sticking out of your boots.</strong><strong>说服并非简单选择最高的数字，它的成败取决于你的谈话对象、自身外在面貌以及声誉好坏。例如，仅凭武力恐吓一帮恶徒往往无济于事，就好像鞋子上沾着茅草却还声称自己是个贵族一样。</strong>
ui_helpoverlay_skirmishMultipleOpponents_s1000In the picture you can see the player being outnumbered. If you now step to the right, the opponents on the left will have to go around their teammate, giving you some time to deal with the first opponent.在这张图画中，你可以看到玩家正处于人数劣势。如果你现在向右走一步，左边的对手就不得不绕过他们的同伴，如此一来你便得到了一些解决掉第一个敌人的时间。
ui_helpoverlay_stealthTakedown0_s0100<accent>Sneaking</accent><br/>To perform a stealth attack, you will first have to sneak up to your victim from behind.<br/> <br/><label>Chokeholds</label> allow you to knock out your victim without killing them.<br/> <br/><label>Stealth kills</label> allow you to quickly and quietly kill your victim if you have a dagger equipped.<accent>潜行攻击</accent><br/>要进行潜行攻击，首先需要从背后接近目标。<br/> <br/><label>锁喉</label>可以让你击晕目标而非杀死对方。<br/> <br/><label>暗杀</label>可以让你用匕首快速而安静地杀死目标。

ui_loading_hint_39Belladonna, an essential ingredient for Saviour Schnapps, grows mainly in clearings and leafy forests. If you don't know where to find a certain herb, check the Herbs section of the Crafting tab in your inventory.颠茄，制作救世干酒的必备成分，多生于林中空地和茂密林间。如需了解某种草药在哪里可以找到，请查阅物品栏中“制造”选项卡的“草药”部分。
ui_loading_hint_44Throwing stones will only attract people if they didn't see you throw it and they're close enough to hear the sound. If you throw stones directly at people, you'll make them mad, and they'll want to punish you for it.只有在人们没看到你，而且离你很近时，才会被扔石头的声音吸引注意力。如果你直接对着别人扔石头，他们会生气，可能还会给你点颜色看看。

ui_tutorial_cont_stavebni_hut<paragraph>Workshops sprang up around every major construction site and employed stonemasons, stonedressers, carpenters, blacksmiths, carters, rope makers, sawyers, coopers and the like. Unskilled work was done by day labourers. Stone or wooden elements and auxiliary structures were manufactured directly at the works on site, known as the construction yard. The craftsmen often used specialised tools such as wooden hoists, winches, pulleys and rotating cranes, powered by hand or by large tread wheels.</paragraph><paragraph>Quite a number of people worked in construction, among whom natural and informal bonds were formed. The workshop also provided plenty of customers for the surrounding vendors, innkeepers and merchants, and most of the employees stayed overnight in the area. The workshop was run by a master builder who allocated tasks, managed the building process and dealt with the patron (sponsor) of the building.</paragraph><paragraph>主要建筑工地周围会涌现出各种工匠作坊，雇佣各种工人：石匠、石材加工匠、木匠、铁匠、运货工、制绳工、锯木匠、箍桶匠等等，而那些没有技术要求的体力活则交给日工来完成。石料、木料和其他辅助材料直接在工地庭院就地加工。工匠们经常用到的专业工具，如木制升降机、绞盘、滑轮和旋转起重机，均由人力或大型踏轮驱动。</paragraph><paragraph>建筑工地上有大量工人，他们自然而然地形成了紧密的工作关系。工匠作坊还向周边的供应商、酒馆老板和商人源源不断地提供顾客，且大部分雇工都会在作坊附近过夜。作坊由工头管理，负责分配任务、监督工程进度、与建筑的拥有者或赞助人沟通等等。</paragraph>
